image.altText: A man adjusts his tie as he looks at a journalist who sits opposite him

props.synopsis: At this time last year, David Speirs was adamant his position as SA Liberal leader was "100 per cent secure". But the past 12 months have brought almost nothing other than challenges for the now 40-year-old, who last week stood in the dock.

title.children: David Speirs has gone from '100 per cent secure' to a guilty plea

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja at South Australia's Royal Commission into Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence.

props.synopsis: As SA's domestic violence royal commissioner Natasha Stott Despoja prepares her final report, a postcard from an 11-year-old child may well be on her mind. Â

title.children: Seven words at the heart of SA's domestic violence royal commission

image.altText: A portrait of Rob Halliday looking sombre, standing in front of a rocky shore.

props.synopsis: The level of violence faced by school leaders is the worst it's ever been, with both students and their parents reportedly making threats, according to a long-running survey of more than 2,000 principals.

title.children: 'He said, I'm here to kill you': Principals speak out on rising violence

image.altText: A composite image of two missing brothers.

props.synopsis: Police are searching for two young brothers who were reported missing from Adelaide more than a fortnight ago, and are believed to be in the company of their father.

title.children: Search for young brothers reported missing 17 days ago

image.altText: GettyImages-2207446962

props.synopsis: After hitting the winning runs to end a 29-year drought, Jason Sangha says South Australia saved his cricket career.

title.children: 'They have saved my career': Jubilation spills over as SA celebrates Shield win

image.altText: Two women holding a large picture of a young child surrounded by fallen leaves

props.synopsis: Grandmother Mariya Samkova has made a new home in an Australian country town, but dreams of returning one day to Ukraine to see her relatives and friends.

title.children: Ukrainian woman who became a refugee in her 70s builds new Aussie life

image.altText: Cathy Freeman beams at her 2000 medal ceremony. Bruce McAvaney smiles with greying hair

props.synopsis: Following this week's unveiling of the Brisbane 2032 Olympics plan, we took a dive into the archives to relive, in the words of Bruce McAvaney, one of Australia's most memorable sporting moments.Â

title.children: Freeman's 'incredible' 400m victory retold by the man who called the race

image.altText: A Singapore Airlines flight comes into land at Adelaide Airport.

props.synopsis: In South Australia, only two marginal seats are regarded as up for grabs at this election, so the campaign jets might not be descending with anything like the same frequency as they will elsewhere, writes Kathryn Bermingham.

title.children: Two SA seats will be hotly contested in the federal election

image.altText: A mob of kangaroos in a dry paddock with some lying down

props.synopsis: An expert has called for the marsupials' deaths to be investigated after previous occurrences were dismissed as being caused by a grass that can cause "staggers' in kangaroos. WARNING: This story contains content that readers may find distressing.

title.children: Kangaroos found dead, paralysed near SA beach affected by algal bloom

image.altText: GettyImages-2207446971

props.synopsis: The leaders of Melbourne Victory's North Terrace supporter group boycotted the club's Pride Cup game against Adelaide United.

title.children: Melbourne Victory supporter group slammed over Pride Cup boycott

image.altText: An excavator and three people in a field.

props.synopsis: A private search for clues relating to the presumed abduction and murder of Joanne Ratcliffe and Kirste Gordon, who disappeared from Adelaide Oval in 1973, begins in South Australia's Mid North.

title.children: Search underway 52 years after girls disappeared from Adelaide Oval

image.altText: A woman serves in a clothes store.

props.synopsis: As its owner orders a review of operations, workers and small businesses worry the city won't survive without the smelter, its major employer and economic driver.Â

title.children: Port Pirie residents fear life in a 'ghost town' if smelter closes

image.altText: Two smiling women stand either side of a man with a big red beard holding an infant.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill steps up for the family of a boy born with a rare and debilitating genetic condition. But none will go further than Mitch McKenny, who is ready to run 27 marathons in 27 days to raise awareness and funds for research into the syndrome.

title.children: Tiny Huxley needs a hero. He's found one in marathon man Mitch

image.altText: People at voting boots.

props.synopsis: Gen Z and millennials will outnumber Baby Boomers on polling day. What do we know about their political beliefs?

title.children: Will younger voters contribute to the Trump bump?

image.altText: The outside of Midland Hospital.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor pledges to contribute $200 million for a $355m upgrade of St John Of God Midland Public Hospital, if re-elected in May.

title.children: Albanese to announce joint $355m upgrade to Perth hospital

image.altText: man with faded red bucket hat, navy tshirt holds steering wheel inside tractor cabin with 4 young boys, 2 seated on each side

props.synopsis: In Australia the Crown owns all resources under the ground, regardless of who owns the property. Therefore the Byrne family face a lengthy and costly legal battle with limited prospects of success.

title.children: Fifth-generation farming family determined to protect their land from miners

image.altText: Caleb Serong smiles while wearing the Glendinning-Allan Medal

props.synopsis: Fremantle dominates Western Derby 60 and runs out 38-point winners over a poor West Coast, with Caleb Serong winning his fourth Glendinning-Allan Medal, after Adelaide saw off North Melbourne to remain unbeaten.

title.children: Serong ties derby record as Dockers dominate Eagles in battle of the west

image.altText: A supermarket aisle with shelves of rice being advertised as half-price.

props.synopsis: The details of a price gouging ban would only be decided after an election, but there are precedents to draw on.

title.children: Examining Labor's promise to ban supermarkets from price gouging

image.altText: tnoga islands

props.synopsis: The US Tsunami Warning Centre earlier warned waves were possible within 300 kilometres of the epicentre, which struck approximately 100 kilometres off the coast of Tonga.

title.children: Tsunami threat cancelled after magnitude-7.1 earthquake hits Tonga

image.altText: A couple on a scooter rides past a collapsed shrine

props.synopsis: Myanmar's shadow National Unity Government, which coordinates the popular struggle against the ruling military, announces a unilateral partial ceasefire to facilitate earthquake relief efforts.

title.children: 'Nothing short of incredible': Air strikes continue after earthquake in Myanmar

image.altText: A man with red hair and a red beard wearing a suit and a woman with black plaited hair and dark skin holding her chin in hand

props.synopsis: Prince Harry faces explosive bullying allegations as he walks away from the charity he founded in his motherâs name.

title.children: 'Number one risk': Sentebale chair strikes back against Prince Harry

image.altText: anthony albanese holds a baby and smiles for a photo

props.synopsis: Modelling shows Labor ahead in 10 seats where it was behind six weeks ago, putting it in a stronger position to form government.

title.children: Labor pulls ahead in poll that had Dutton in front six weeks ago

image.altText: A young adult man wearing a broad brimmed hat looking over the ocean

props.synopsis: Young men across the world have been embracing right-wing politics, while young women have moved to the left. Will it happen in the Australian election too?

title.children: Young men are flocking to right-wing politicians overseas. In Australia there's 'a twist'

image.altText: compositie of a man and ocean wind turbines

props.synopsis: An anti-wind farm activist group has been accused of "Trumpian-style" attacks on experts and spreading misinformation and conspiracy theories in marginal Labor seats ahead of the May 3 election.

title.children: 'Won't back down': Inside the anti-wind farm crusade threatening Labor seats

image.altText: An excavator constructing a levee to keep out flood water.

props.synopsis: Queensland Premier David Crisafulli warned many communities "are yet to see the worst" of flooding due to the volume of water in catchments across outback Queensland.Â

title.children: Flooded western Queensland has 'choppers everywhere', levee banks spilling

image.altText: A market stall is set up in front of a badly damaged building in Gaza.

props.synopsis: The Hamas militant group says it has accepted a new Gaza ceasefire proposal from mediators Egypt and Qatar, but Israel says it has made a counter-proposal in "full coordination" with the third mediator, the United States.

title.children: Hamas accepts Gaza ceasefire proposal, but Israel makes counteroffer

image.altText: A man in a light denim jacket stands near media at the construction site

props.synopsis: As Pornsak Seingsing ran for his life out of a collapsing high-rise building in Bangkok, he could hear terrified cries at his back.

title.children: As a building collapsed in Bangkok, this worker ran for his life: 'I was the last one'

image.altText: richard chamberlain

props.synopsis: The American actor boasted a six decade-career that spanned theatre, films and television.

title.children: Heartthrob actor Richard Chamberlain, star of The Thorn Birds, dies aged 90

image.altText: Anthony Albanese on Insiders

props.synopsis: In his first major interview of the campaign, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he would be willing to direct gas companies to secure more supplies for Australia if needed, but has downplayed the need for dedicated gas reservation laws as proposed by the Coalition.

title.children: Albanese willing to direct gas exporters to supply Australia 'if needed'

image.altText: The exterior of a Coles shopfront

props.synopsis: More than 20 pre-packaged salad products are being recalled by two major supermarket retailers after Queensland's public health surveillance detected two products contaminated with a strain of E. coli.

title.children: Major supermarkets recall salad products due to contamination concerns

image.altText: sketch of a woman with red hair holding binoculars to her face with silhouettes of birds in the lens

props.synopsis: Since 1959 the avian flu virus H5N1 has been popping up around the globe. Now scientists believe it could spark the next pandemic.

title.children: This flu virus is spreading and scientists say it has pandemic potential

image.altText: Peter Dutton, wearing a yellow high-vis very, pauses while speaking

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton's claim, so early in a contest we're told has an unusually large number of undecided voters, that Anthony Albanese cannot win in his own right has more than just a whiff of arrogance.

title.children: Dutton asked reporters a question of his own, but it might come back to bite

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: A 'lost decade' of low wage growth broke the social compact for young Australians when it comes to housing.

title.children: 'Lost decade' of low wage growth stopped young Australians buying homes
